title: Crew-3: Endurance departs the ISS for its return to Earth
summary: Crew Dragon Endurance has departed from the International Space Station (ISS) as its Crew-3 mission comes to an end. Endurance is carrying astronauts Raja Chari, Kayla Barron, Tom Marshburn, and Matthias Maurer back to Earth after nearly six months in orbit.

title: Air Force’s rocket propulsion arm looking to invest in technologies for ‘responsive launch’
summary: The Air Force Research Laboratory’s rocket propulsion arm is asking space companies to help identify technologies and capabilities the military will need to launch missions on short timelines.

title: Satellogic to launch 68 satellites with SpaceX
summary: Earth imaging company Satellogic announced May 4 it signed a contract with SpaceX to launch 68 more satellites as it continues to build out its constellation.

title: NASA Deputy Administrator to Visit Artemis Partner Advanced Space
summary: Media are invited to join NASA Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy and Representatives Ed Perlmutter, Joe Neguse and Jerry McNerney for a tour of the Westminster, Colorado-based aerospace company Advanced Space Thursday, May 5.

title: DARPA moving forward with development of nuclear powered spacecraft
summary: The Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency on May 4 issued a solicitation for proposals for the next phase of a demonstration of a nuclear powered spacecraft.
